column5: Try Gordon Highlander, it is an exceptional blend.  Also the White & McKay 13 was on sale a couple of weeks ago in LCBO's for 21.00 (reduced from 41.00).  It is a nice blend as well.  I truly enjoy the Bruichladich myself, the last bottle I bought was over 100.00 and that was 7 years ago.  A great gentleman from the board once brought me a bottle back from Scotland...nice fella.
Canadian Beer!!!  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GsgVspgy184...feature=related
15 cans of Budweiser = $20.95 CAD  And this is a special
Someone is gonna piss their self blind eh!!!
Lucky I don't waste my money on beer!!  The price of everything is going up!
Save beer.........drink WHISKEY!!!  S.
Now that's the kind of talk I like to hear!!!
http://money.cnn.com/2009/08/25/news/compa...busch/index.htm  Can't help but think we here in the Great White North will be in the same boat soon! HH

Well, I for one am very happy that the brewers in this country, have absolutely no idea how much us beer drinkers in this province would actually pay, to keep our beer flowing! HH

I'm sure you guys are aware...but they could double the prices in the states and its still cheaper than buying it off our government....
Looks like I'll be jumping ship. Lakeport looks pretty good now.
Beer is for pregnant women and small children!!!
That's cause you folk don't know what real beer is
Yeah, they sell real beer and ales here... we use them for mouthwash!
No one really believes that the ''PRICE '' would ever stop someone from drinking Beer......

If any of you ever get up this way (Southern PA or Maryland) you should check out our local favorite.  National BohemianNatty Bo!.  It is presented as being from the land of pleasant living.  I agree!  Another cool PA beer factoid is the eternal tap in St. Mary's, PA.  Learn about the Eternal Tap  PA's most famous beer is now being distributed across the Eastern Seaboard to compete with Sam Adams, Yuengling Lager.  Here we just order "A lager" from the waitress or bartender and our beer will be delivered cold, no questions asked.  My beer of choice these days is Yuengling Premium Light.  Americas Oldest Brewery.  If you haven't had "a Lager" you should keep American beer slams to a minimum.
Success!!!... we have brainwashed another Canuckian!!!   ... I've got a Loggerhead... does that count???
That is a damn fine point you are making there Mr. Green Trout Whipper!!!

I failed to mention that three cases combined...  Straub Natty Bo Yuengling Premium Lite  24 cans x 3 cases = 72 beers 3 cases (11.45+10.95+15.00) = 37.40  You could subtract 1.50 if you buy them "warm" as they do charge here for cold beer.

Dats 'cause you live in Pennsyltucky!!!
So far...So Good!

I likely haven't had more than 15 or 18 beers in the last 3 years, since I developed diabetes and any more than 1 skyrockets my glucose readings.  I was always an ale drinker though, as in the time and place that I grew up, lager was considered a ladies' drink.  Real men drank ale.  Thankfully, scotch doesn't have the same effect on my glucose and if they mess with the price of Johnny Walker anymore, I can find something else.  I'm not real picky.
I've had the Yeungling down in PA. Not bad fer a "lager".  I'll stick to my ales, reds, porter and stout. Otherwise known as man beer. Olands Red, now there is a beer.
